trans-unit.source: Learn about Throttling in BizTalk Services | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Learn about Throttling in BizTalk Services | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn about throttling thresholds and resulting runtime behaviors for BizTalk Services. Throttling is based on memory usage and number of messages. MABS, WABS
trans-unit.target: Learn about throttling thresholds and resulting runtime behaviors for BizTalk Services. Throttling is based on memory usage and number of messages. MABS, WABS

trans-unit.source: Azure BizTalk Services implements service throttling based on two conditions: memory usage and the number of simultaneous messages processing.
trans-unit.target: Azure BizTalk Services implements service throttling based on two conditions: memory usage and the number of simultaneous messages processing.

trans-unit.source: This topic lists the throttling thresholds and describes the Runtime behavior when a throttling condition occurs.
trans-unit.target: This topic lists the throttling thresholds and describes the Runtime behavior when a throttling condition occurs.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the throttling source and thresholds:
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the throttling source and thresholds:

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Low Threshold
trans-unit.target: Low Threshold

trans-unit.source: High Threshold
trans-unit.target: High Threshold

trans-unit.source: Memory
trans-unit.target: Memory

trans-unit.source:
% of total system memory available/PageFileBytes.

Total available PageFileBytes is approximately 2 times the RAM of the system.
trans-unit.target:
% of total system memory available/PageFileBytes.

Total available PageFileBytes is approximately 2 times the RAM of the system.

trans-unit.source: Message Processing
trans-unit.target: Message Processing

trans-unit.source: Number of messages processing simultaneously
trans-unit.target: Number of messages processing simultaneously

trans-unit.source: 40 * number of cores
trans-unit.target: 40 * number of cores

trans-unit.source: 100 * number of cores
trans-unit.target: 100 * number of cores

trans-unit.source: When a high threshold is reached, Azure BizTalk Services starts to throttle.
trans-unit.target: When a high threshold is reached, Azure BizTalk Services starts to throttle.

trans-unit.source: Throttling stops when the low threshold is reached.
trans-unit.target: Throttling stops when the low threshold is reached.

trans-unit.source: For example, your service is using 65% system memory.
trans-unit.target: For example, your service is using 65% system memory.

trans-unit.source: In this situation, the service does not throttle.
trans-unit.target: In this situation, the service does not throttle.

trans-unit.source: Your service starts using 70% system memory.
trans-unit.target: Your service starts using 70% system memory.

trans-unit.source: In this situation, the service throttles and continues to throttle until the service uses 60% (low threshold) system memory.
trans-unit.target: In this situation, the service throttles and continues to throttle until the service uses 60% (low threshold) system memory.

trans-unit.source: Azure BizTalk Services tracks the throttling status (normal state vs. throttled state) and the throttling duration.
trans-unit.target: Azure BizTalk Services tracks the throttling status (normal state vs. throttled state) and the throttling duration.

trans-unit.source: When Azure BizTalk Services enters a throttling state, the following occurs:
trans-unit.target: When Azure BizTalk Services enters a throttling state, the following occurs:

trans-unit.source: Throttling is per role instance.
trans-unit.target: Throttling is per role instance.

trans-unit.source:
For example:
RoleInstanceA is throttling.
trans-unit.target:
For example:
RoleInstanceA is throttling.

trans-unit.source: RoleInstanceB is not throttling.
trans-unit.target: RoleInstanceB is not throttling.

trans-unit.source: In this situation, messages in RoleInstanceB are processed as expected.
trans-unit.target: In this situation, messages in RoleInstanceB are processed as expected.

trans-unit.source:
Messages in RoleInstanceA are discarded and fail with the following error:

**Server is busy.
trans-unit.target:
Messages in RoleInstanceA are discarded and fail with the following error:

**Server is busy.

trans-unit.source: Please try again.**
trans-unit.target: Please try again.**

trans-unit.source: Any pull sources do not poll or download a message.
trans-unit.target: Any pull sources do not poll or download a message.

trans-unit.source:
For example:
A pipeline pulls messages from an external FTP source.
trans-unit.target:
For example:
A pipeline pulls messages from an external FTP source.

trans-unit.source: The role instance doing the pull gets into a throttling state.
trans-unit.target: The role instance doing the pull gets into a throttling state.

trans-unit.source: In this situation, the pipeline stops downloading additional messages until the role instance stops throttling.
trans-unit.target: In this situation, the pipeline stops downloading additional messages until the role instance stops throttling.

trans-unit.source: A response is sent to the client so the client can resubmit the message.
trans-unit.target: A response is sent to the client so the client can resubmit the message.

trans-unit.source: You must wait until the throttling is resolved.
trans-unit.target: You must wait until the throttling is resolved.

trans-unit.source: Specifically, you must wait until the low threshold is reached.
trans-unit.target: Specifically, you must wait until the low threshold is reached.

trans-unit.source: Throttling cannot be disabled.
trans-unit.target: Throttling cannot be disabled.

trans-unit.source: Throttling thresholds cannot be modified.
trans-unit.target: Throttling thresholds cannot be modified.

trans-unit.source: Throttling is implemented system-wide.
trans-unit.target: Throttling is implemented system-wide.

trans-unit.source: The Azure SQL Database Server also has built-in throttling.
trans-unit.target: The Azure SQL Database Server also has built-in throttling.
